page.title: 08CLUBS GUIDES IN MARKFIELD
page.content: Ginette and I started Guides at different times. When I was enrolled I was scared.There was no need. The girls made four lines and they walked round until they formed a horseshoe. Eventually we all stood still with the leaders at the front.I then stepped forward with my patrol leader.The leader asked me to say the promise: 'I promise to do my duty to God, to serve the Queen, to help other people and to keep the Guide law.' Then I was given a certificate and told I was a Guide.Guides have challenges to do: for example,enjoying the outdoors, keeping fit, thinking for yourself, giving service, exploring the arts, becoming a homemaker, keeping the Guide laws and getting to know people. We go to Guides on a Tuesday night from 7.00 until 8.30.
